channel.title: Owner
channel.description:
So as I expressed on one of my other posts, this server that I downloaded was already partially coded and had admins and owners etc. So I went ahead and set my Rights to 3 (Owner) and made theirs 0. So when I log in, it says basically nothing for me. But if I log in on the account that was the owner originally "Regisoul" who I changed his power to 0, it says The Owner of the server has logged in! Welcome Back Regisoul Or something like that, and he can use the commands ::mypos because only owner can do that on this server So on the account "Speakmore" that I made that I once again, gave power=3, he can't use ::mypos and it doesn't state that I'm the owner. Does anyone understand what I'm saying, and/or can help?
Also, I guess how may I edit it so it says welcome the Owner, but to Speakmore?

item.title: Owner
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Speakmore, post:13, topic:419724”]Yes
I am using 1.6.0 I knew that, just not how to fix, not that it bought it was ever a problem But thanks
I’m currently on my iPad, I will let you know tomorrow when I get on to code some more[/quote]

Alrighty.

Read full topic

item.title: Owner
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Speakmore, post:11, topic:419724”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=522260.msg3797707#msg3797707 date=1319766838]
Edit the compiler.bat and change the jdk to your version of jdk.
[/quote]
Oh okay, thanks. Lt me try that[/quote]

To check to see what version of jdk you have, go to this:

And there will be folders there that say something like this: jdk1.6.0_26

(Program Files or Program Files (x86), where ever you put your java stuff at.)

Read full topic

item.title: Owner
item.dc:creator: @Speakmore Speakmore
item.description:
@Speakmore wrote:

So I did as you said, went into Source
Typed in Regisoul
He popped up in 4
I opened each up
CLicked CTRL-H
Put his name in Find (the first one)
and put Speakmore in Replace
Then click Replace All, I did this for each file. Yet when I log in, 1) It doesn’t say welcome owner etc.
2) When I log in on him, it works again… any idea?

SO his character sheet isn’t even there.
So when I make a new account like jsut now called Regisoul, he has 0 power. Yet he is the only one that can do the owners commands… not even my character that I 1) replaced his stuff with and 2) Gave power=3

Read full topic

item.title: Owner
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Rushed Mr Rushed
item.description:
@Mr_Rushed wrote:

This is really simple!!, Open your source folder, In your search bar search for Regisoul, Open the files it finds Regisoul in and when open the java files it is found in, once opened press ctrl+h, In the top one put regisoul in the second one put whatever your owner name is, Click Replace all, Do this in all the java files it has found Regisoul in.

You should understand this guide I made for you or you might aswell quit rsps.

Read full topic

So as I expressed on one of my other posts, this server that I downloaded was already partially coded and had admins and owners etc. So I went ahead and set my Rights to 3 (Owner) and made theirs 0. The Owner of the server has logged in!
Welcome Back Regisoul
